description: Gets information about an existing retriever used by an Amazon Q Business application.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application using the retriever.

nested_items.name: applicationId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application using the retriever.

nested_items.name: retrieverId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the retriever.

nested_items.name: retrieverArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the retriever.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the retriever.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the retriever.

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: The name of the retriever.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: Provides information on how the retriever used for your Amazon Q Business application is configured.

nested_items.name: nativeIndexConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on how a Amazon Q Business index used as a retriever for your Amazon Q Business application is configured.

nested_items.name: indexId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the Amazon Q Business index.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A read-only field that specifies the version of the NativeIndexConfiguration.
Version 2 supports a single Date field (created_at OR last_updated_at) for recency boosting.
Version 2 supports a single String field with an ordered list of up to 5 values.
Version 2 introduces number-based boost levels (ONE, TWO) alongside the text-based levels.
Version 2 allows specifying prioritization between Date and String fields.
Version 2 maintains backward compatibility with existing configurations.

nested_items.name: boostingOverride
nested_items.description: Overrides the default boosts applied by Amazon Q Business to supported document attribute data types.

nested_items.name: numberConfiguration
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: numberConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on boosting NUMBER type document attributes.

nested_items.name: boostingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the priority of boosted document attributes in relation to other boosted attributes. This parameter determines how strongly the attribute influences document ranking in search results. NUMBER attributes can serve as additional boosting factors when needed, but are not supported when using NativeIndexConfiguration version 2.

nested_items.name: boostingType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether higher or lower numeric values should be prioritized when boosting. Valid values are ASCENDING (higher numbers are more important) and DESCENDING (lower numbers are more important).

nested_items.name: stringConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on boosting STRING type document attributes.

nested_items.name: boostingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the priority tier ranking of boosting applied to document attributes. For version 2, this parameter indicates the relative ranking between boosted fields (ONE being highest priority, TWO being second highest, etc.) and determines the order in which attributes influence document ranking in search results. For version 1, this parameter specifies the boosting intensity. For version 2, boosting intensity (VERY HIGH, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW, NONE) are not supported. Note that in version 2, you are not allowed to boost on only one field and make this value TWO.

nested_items.name: attributeValueBoosting
nested_items.description: Specifies specific values of a STRING type document attribute being boosted. When using NativeIndexConfiguration version 2, you can specify up to five values in order of priority.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: dateConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on boosting DATE type document attributes.

nested_items.name: boostingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the priority tier ranking of boosting applied to document attributes. For version 2, this parameter indicates the relative ranking between boosted fields (ONE being highest priority, TWO being second highest, etc.) and determines the order in which attributes influence document ranking in search results. For version 1, this parameter specifies the boosting intensity. For version 2, boosting intensity (VERY HIGH, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW, NONE) are not supported. Note that in version 2, you are not allowed to boost on only one field and make this value TWO.

nested_items.name: boostingDurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the duration, in seconds, of a boost applies to a DATE type document attribute.

nested_items.name: stringListConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on boosting STRING_LIST type document attributes.

nested_items.name: boostingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the priority of boosted document attributes in relation to other boosted attributes. This parameter determines how strongly the attribute influences document ranking in search results. STRING_LIST attributes can serve as additional boosting factors when needed, but are not supported when using NativeIndexConfiguration version 2.

nested_items.name: kendraIndexConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information on how the Amazon Kendra index used as a retriever for your Amazon Q Business application is configured.

nested_items.name: indexId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon Kendra index.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role with the permission to access the retriever and required resources.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the retriever was created.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the retriever was last updated.
